info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 16 at 1:42AM CDT until April 16 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HASKELL...NORTHEASTERN MCINTOSH...SEQUOYAH... SOUTHWESTERN ADAIR...NORTH CENTRAL LE FLORE...SOUTH CENTRAL WAGONER...SOUTHEASTERN CHEROKEE...MUSKOGEE AND NORTHEASTERN OKMULGEE COUNTIES... At 141 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Council Hill to 6 miles east of Boynton to 2 miles southwest of Tamaha to 2 miles northwest of Panama to 2 miles west of Arkoma, moving east at 25 mph. An additional severe thunderstorm as located near box, moving northeast at 25. HAZARD...Half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Okmulgee... Sallisaw... Fort Gibson... Muldrow... Checotah... Roland... Spiro... Haskell... Warner... Morris... Vian... Panama... Gore... Webbers Falls... Keota... Bokoshe... Oktaha... Gans... Marble City... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 256 and 324. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
